title: Executive Order 5159-Establishing Reidsville, North Carolina as a Customs Port of Entry
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the Act of Congress approved August 1, 1914, making appropriations for the sundry, civil expenses of the Government for the fiscal year ended June 30, 1915, Reidsville, North Carolina, is hereby created a port of entry in Customs Collection District No. 15 (North Carolina) with headquarters at Wilmington, North Carolina, effective thirty days from the date of this order.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5159-Establishing Reidsville, North Carolina as a Customs Port of Entry Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/360858
